interestingFact: Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world.
Japan is home to the world's oldest continuously operating company, Kongo Gumi, founded in 578 AD.
Brazil is the largest country in South America and is famous for the Amazon Rainforest.
Australia is home to the world's longest fence, the Dingo Fence, which stretches over 5,600 kilometers.
Germany is known for its castles, with over 25,000 spread throughout the country.
India is the world's largest democracy and has over 1,600 languages spoken.
France is the most visited country in the world, with over 89 million tourists annually.
Mexico introduced chocolate, chilies, and corn to the world.
Italy is home to the most UNESCO World Heritage Sites, with 58 recognized.
South Africa is the only country to have hosted the FIFA World Cup on three different occasions.
